snippet: A bill limiting when the police can use deadly force is dead for the session after the State Senate quit early without voting on it.
abstract: Missouri State Senate ends session before voting on bill passed by House that limits when police can use deadly force; bill was passed in wake of fatal shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson.
lead_paragraph: A bill limiting when the police can use deadly force is dead for the session after the State Senate quit early without voting on it.

headline.main: Missouri: No Vote on Change to Deadly Force Law
headline.print_headline: Missouri: No Vote on Change to Deadly Force Law
